Description: Typical range for industrial Nd:YAG laser cleaning of refractory metals like Iridium, starting low due to high reflectivity (~90% at 1064 nm) to avoid excessive heating; max limited to prevent melting (mp 2446°C). Recommended start at 100 W for contamination removal. Source: IPG Photonics specs for YLR series; conservative estimate from metal cleaning studies (e.g., J. Laser Appl. 2018).
Fundamental Nd:YAG wavelength with good Iridium absorption
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning control
Optimal repetition rate for continuous cleaning coverage
Short pulse duration for efficient ablation with minimal heat diffusion
Optimal scanning speed for efficient area coverage
Recommended number of passes for complete contamination removal
Optimal beam overlap for uniform cleaning results
